prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing thank-you greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Birthday card with cute cats and a big dog looking at them"
Style: ðŸŽ¨ Watercolor
Tone: ðŸ˜„ Funny - humorous and lighthearted
To: Alex
From: Alex
Message: "[Blank space for handwritten message]"
Note: Include space for handwritten message


CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the humorous and lighthearted tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way
- Include visual humor, playful elements, and whimsical details







Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "thank-you" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a thank-you card with humorous and lighthearted tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Design with elegant writing space that complements the visual story from left interior. Position decorative elements safely away from top/bottom edges. Create innovative and artistic decorative elements, borders, or flourishes that are unique and memorable - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover:
```json
{
  "frontCover": "Front cover of a greeting card with a warm, light yellow watercolor wash background. The text \"Thank You!\" is prominently displayed in the upper center in a flowing, elegant, dark teal handwritten cursive script. Below the text, a thin, warm orange string is stretched horizontally across the mid-section. Hanging from this string are three stylized, cute cartoon cats: an orange tabby cat on the left, a Siamese cat in the center with one paw raised as if climbing, and a fluffy black cat on the right looking surprised. Interspersed between the cats and slightly behind them are soft, circular watercolor blobs in pastel shades of yellow, blue, and peach. At the bottom, a friendly, smiling golden retriever dog sits attentively, looking upwards at the cats with a joyful expression. The overall style is charming watercolor with visible brush strokes and soft paint bleeds, evoking a humorous and lighthearted mood. The composition is designed for a 9:16 ratio, with key elements kept away from the edges.",
  "backCover": "Back cover of a greeting card with a soft, light yellow watercolor wash background, subtly referencing the front cover's color palette. In the upper center, a delicate, thin orange string element is present, reminiscent of the one on the front. Below the string, a single, small, round watercolor shape in a soft pastel color (like peach or light blue) is positioned. The rest of the background is a clean watercolor wash with minimal texture. The bottom right corner, approximately a 1-inch square, is completely clear and undecorated for a QR code. The focus is on a minimalist, serene, and subtly creative decorative design that provides a peaceful closure to the visual story, avoiding any text or characters.",
  "leftInterior": "Left interior of a greeting card with a light yellow watercolor wash background, consistent with the front cover. This side features a playful scene where the three cats from the front cover are now engaged in a more dynamic and humorous activity. The orange tabby cat might be attempting to catch a dangling string, the Siamese cat could be mid-leap, and the black cat might be playfully batting at a floating watercolor bubble. The golden retriever from the front cover is visible in the lower section, perhaps peeking from behind a corner or lying down contentedly, observing the cats' antics with amusement. Soft, circular watercolor blobs in pastel shades of yellow, blue, and peach are scattered across the background, maintaining the visual continuity. The overall mood is lighthearted and whimsical, showcasing the ongoing playful interaction in a distinct watercolor style with soft brush strokes and organic paint bleeds. This side is entirely visual with no text.",
  "rightInterior": "Right interior of a greeting card, designed to complement the left interior spread, featuring a light yellow watercolor wash background. This side is primarily a writing space, with decorative elements framing the message area. Elegant, flowing watercolor flourishes in soft teal and warm orange, echoing the colors of the text and string from the front cover, are placed along the edges and corners of the writing space. These flourishes are stylized and artistic, perhaps incorporating subtle leaf or swirl motifs within the watercolor style. The central area is kept clear and clean for handwritten messages. The decorative elements are designed to be unique and memorable, avoiding clichÃ©s and maintaining the charming, lighthearted watercolor aesthetic. No characters are present on this side, and the text \"\[Blank space for handwritten message]\" is not visually depicted but is implied to be within the cleared writing space."
}
```
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a delicate, whimsical watercolor style. The background is a soft, creamy off-white with subtle paper texture and gentle washes of pale yellow, evoking warmth and a serene atmosphere. Dominating the upper left portion of the image is a gracefully rendered, stylized golden-brown dog's tail, depicted in a sweeping curl. The tail exhibits soft, painterly strokes that mimic fur texture, with a dynamic, organic flow. Beneath the tail, towards the lower left, are a few small, scattered watercolor dots in muted pastel colors: a soft peach, a light blue-grey, and a pale yellow. These elements are intentionally sparse and understated, providing a peaceful, complementary conclusion to a potential narrative from the front and interior of the card. There is no text present, and the design is largely contained in the upper left, leaving the majority of the space clear. The composition is minimal and airy, with a reserved, artistic touch. There is no visible space reserved for a QR code, but the design elements are concentrated away from the lower right corner, implying a potential clearing for such a purpose.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a whimsical and humorous watercolor illustration. The scene depicts three cartoon-style cats in mid-air, tumbling and looking surprised, with their paws outstretched in a playful manner. An orange tabby cat with wide, expressive eyes is at the top, falling slightly to the right. Below and to the left is a grey tabby cat with a similar astonished expression. At the bottom right, another orange tabby cat is also mid-fall, with its body contorted. The cats are surrounded by colorful watercolor splashes and translucent, iridescent bubbles, suggesting a chaotic and joyous moment. The background is a light, textured cream color, with subtle watercolor washes and splatters in warm hues of orange, yellow, blue, and pink, creating a vibrant yet soft atmosphere. The overall artistic style is that of loose, expressive watercolor painting, with visible brush strokes and organic paint bleeds, contributing to the lighthearted and dynamic feel. There is no text present on this page, leaving ample space for a handwritten message.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a warm, creamy yellow watercolor wash background. The left side of the page features the head and shoulders of a friendly golden retriever, painted in soft watercolor strokes, with its head turned slightly to the right, looking into the blank space. Delicate, pale yellow botanical swirls and leaves frame the bottom left and right edges, extending upwards, creating a subtle, organic border. The top of the page is adorned with the curved tails of cats â€“ an orange tabby tail, a dark grey tail, and another brown and black striped tail â€“ also rendered in a watercolor style, suggesting they are positioned above. The central area is a large, open space for a handwritten message. In the bottom right quadrant of this blank space, the name "Alex" is elegantly written in a deep teal, flowing cursive script, with "From: Alex" written in a smaller, complementary font directly below it. The overall impression is one of gentle whimsy and warmth, with ample room for personal sentiment.
